title: I'm thinking of starting a dad joke podcast...
self_text: But it needs some work. It's got a lot of pauses in the punchlines.

title: AITA for letting my little brother stay at my place when he has covid?
self_text:
I (23F) am a student currently living in an apartment with my boyfriend (24M). My little brother, David (18M), is away at college but came home after testing positive for COVID. He’s been staying here for about a week now, and while he’s being careful to isolate from us as much as possible, it’s still stressful having someone sick in the house. I made him agree to stay in the spare bedroom, wear a mask whenever he leaves his room, and disinfect everything he touches. My boyfriend is immunocompromised due to a medical condition, so I’m really worried about him getting sick. 

I told my mom that David was staying here and she got mad at me, saying I should have insisted he quarantine at his friend's place or something instead of putting my boyfriend at risk. She thinks I’m prioritizing David over my boyfriend, and even accused me of not caring about my boyfriend’s health. I tried explaining that I didn’t want David to be alone while he was sick, and that I thought I could manage the situation safely, but she wasn’t buying it. She said I was being selfish and irresponsible.

Now, my boyfriend is also upset because he feels like I didn’t fully consider the risks before agreeing to let David stay here. He says he understands I wanted to help our brother, but he’s scared and anxious about potentially getting sick. He hasn’t explicitly blamed me, but he’s definitely withdrawn and seems resentful.

Am I the asshole for letting my little brother stay here despite the risk to my boyfriend? Should I have found another solution for David’s quarantine?

title: AITA for telling my friend he has a weird way of eating his spaghetti?
self_text: My friend and I were at the Italian place we always go to, and he was eating his spaghetti with a fork and knife…like a maniac. He cuts the spaghetti into tiny pieces then puts it on his spoon before eating it. It’s honestly just disgusting to watch. I told him “dude you are really cutting your spaghetti up like a toddler” and he got super offended. I think he’s being dramatic but now he won’t talk to me. Am I the asshole?

title: The guy who invented the car alarm is now sleeping with the windows down...
AITA for wanting to have a little girl?
self_text: I’m an attorney, and my husband is a doctor. We make great money, we live in the suburbs, we are very happy. My husband and I have had 3 boys, all who are amazing kids! They are all good at sports, they get good grades, and they are kind people. But honestly, I am so sad that we haven’t had a little girl yet. I know it sounds shallow but I’ve always wanted a daughter. The thought of dressing her up, doing her hair, having tea parties, taking her shopping, etc., just makes me feel warm inside.  My husband says that he doesn’t care what gender our children are as long as they are healthy and happy. He also thinks that it’s unfair to want another child based on their gender. I think he’s right but I can’t help but want a daughter. I really don’t think I would be able to handle not having a little girl in my life. Should I try to convince him to have another baby or should I let it go?

title: AITA for refusing to let my brother go with me on a trip?
self_text: I (28f) am planning a girls’ weekend with some of my close friends, we haven't seen each other in months so I thought it would be nice. My brother (26m) has been really clingy lately and he asked if he could come. He said that he wanted to spend time with me since he hasn't had the chance to recently and he knows how much I enjoy spending time with him. I told him no because it's a GIRLS' weekend and he is not invited. He went off on me saying that I don't care about his feelings and that I always exclude him from things. I told him that I love him but this is something I want to do with my friends without him there. I feel like he doesn't respect boundaries. Am I TA here?

title: AITA for not wanting to pay my best friends rent?
self_text: I (27F) have been living with my best friend, let's call her Sarah (28F), since we were both in college. We agreed that she would cover the majority of the rent because she has a job and makes good money while I was finishing school and working part-time. Now that I have graduated and have a full time job making more than enough to help out, Sarah is saying I need to start paying half the rent. She says it isn't fair that she covers so much of the bills and now that I can afford it I should be doing my part. However, I promised her when we moved in that I wouldn’t ask her to increase my share of the rent if I got a new job, which I didn’t do. Now I am getting paid more but she still has a higher salary overall. I feel like our agreement stands, even though I make more now. Am I the asshole?

title: AITA for having a long distance relationship with my brother?
self_text: I know that sounds weird, but we are both in our early twenties and have been together for nearly 10 years. He lives in Germany while I live in the US. We've been dating since we were kids and it was always something casual as we never really talked about where it would go or what kind of future we wanted. But now that we're adults things are starting to get serious because he wants to move here to be with me. My parents don't approve of us being together because they say it's wrong and disgusting. They aren't religious so I can't chalk it up to them trying to tell me what to do based on their beliefs. I told him how my parents feel and he got upset at them for not supporting our relationship. We had a big fight last night after his mom tried calling me and telling me to break up with her son. He said he doesn't want to come here anymore if my family isn't going to accept us. I love him very much and I want him to be happy, but I also don't want to lose my family over this. How do I navigate this situation?

title: AITA for telling my friends I'm not going to be attending their wedding because it's on the same day as a concert?
self_text: So, I have been planning to see Ghost since they announced their tour dates back in February of this year. It's always been a dream of mine to attend one of their concerts and when they were coming so close to where I live, I immediately bought tickets. Now, about two weeks ago, my friends who have been dating for four years got engaged and set the date for their wedding on that exact night! They told me the news yesterday but didn’t ask if I could make it or anything, they just assumed I would want to go. Now, I feel terrible because I really do care about them and I am happy for them but I already have non refundable plans. They are upset at me for saying I’m missing their wedding, which is something I don’t understand. I even offered to get them a gift and take them out to dinner but they aren’t having it. Am I the asshole for prioritizing a concert over my friends’ wedding?
